result.execSummary:
The defendant Valerie Michelle Mathis was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Valerie Michelle Mathis

defendant.name: Mathis, Valerie Michelle
defendant.address: 3830 W Mt Vernon Ave, Milwaukee, WI 53208

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Valerie Michelle Mathis in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  

Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Court ordered defendant to pay a FINE of $200.00 INCLUDING ALL COSTS and SURCHARGES; cash bail on deposit to be applied.  Court ordered the defendant to submit a DNA sample and pay the DNA surcharge by 06-14-2016 or, if not paid, convert to a civil judgment.

Defendant Valerie Michelle Mathis in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  The defendant appeared late.  Court ordered the warrant (not printed) cancelled.  Court ordered bail set at $200.00 cash.  Court ordered case adjourned for jury trial in Branch 24.  Jury trial scheduled for December 14, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Valerie Michelle Mathis not in court.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Case calendared for jury trial.  Attorney Matthew Lamke was in court earlier but the court was advised the defendant has not checked in.  
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant to be issued.  State's motion for Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from Clerk of Circuit Court's Office is granted by the Court. 

NOTE:  COURT RECOMMENDS HIGH CASH BAIL.

Defendant Valerie Michelle Mathis in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Final pretrial held.  Case remains calendared for jury trial on Ocotber 19, 2015 at 8:30 am in Branch 24.

Defendant Valerie Michelle Mathis in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Case calendared for plea/sentencing hearing.  Defense requested a final pretrial and jury trial date in Branch 24.  Court reiterated the no contact order.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for October 19, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Valerie Michelle Mathis in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 24.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Valerie Michelle Mathis in court pro-se.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Pro-se defendant may be public defender eligible. Court referred defendant to Public Defender's office for eligibility status.   Court ordered case adjourned for status of counsel in Branch 24.  Status conference scheduled for June 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with any Sentry Food Stores.

Defendant Valerie Michelle Mathis in court.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Protasiewicz, Branch 24.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant.  Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant was given a referral to the Public Defender's Office. Defendant MAY be Public Defender eligible. Defendant states she doesn't want public defender representation. The case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Br. 24.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.
SUMMONS MAILED. DEFENDANT ORDERED INTO ROOM 221 SAFETY BUILDING ON 06-05-2015 at 01:30pm
